title: User Authentication and Multi-Factor Security
summary: Implement secure, compliant, and multi-factor authentication for portal access.
description: Develop a comprehensive authentication and security framework that enables customers to log in securely using multi-factor authentication (MFA). Incorporate encryption, session management, password policies, and secure data handling that align with financial security regulations. This ensures only authenticated and verified users access the portal while protecting sensitive data from unauthorized exposure.

title: Responsive and Intuitive User Interface
summary: Design a modern, responsive UI accessible across devices and screen sizes.
description: Create a responsive web interface that adapts seamlessly across desktop, tablet, and mobile devices. The interface should emphasize simplicity, clarity, and ease of navigation with minimal clicks required to access core services. The UI should comply with accessibility standards, support dynamic resizing, and maintain consistent experience regardless of device type or resolution.

title: Personalized Customer Dashboard
summary: Develop a dynamic dashboard that presents personalized information and services.
description: Implement a personalized dashboard that displays tailored banking services, account details, and available products based on customer profile and eligibility. The dashboard should serve as the control center for all key functions such as account management, service requests, notifications, and application status tracking. Enable quick navigation and contextual recommendations to improve the customer experience.

title: Digital Account Opening and Service Request Workflows
summary: Enable customers to open new accounts and modify services via digital workflows.
description: Create guided workflows that allow customers to initiate new account openings and modify existing banking services from within the portal. Ensure workflows are simple, fast, and compliant—minimizing complexity and optimizing performance. Integrate approval processes, field-level validation, and data pre-population to enhance efficiency for both customers and operational teams.

title: Document Upload and Management System
summary: Allow users to securely upload, manage, and store required documents.
description: Implement a secure and user-friendly document upload feature for account applications and service modifications. The system should support multiple file types, encryption during transfer and storage, virus scanning, and retrieval functionality. It must ensure uploaded documents are correctly associated with the respective user profiles and workflows for processing and compliance purposes.

title: Save and Resume Application Functionality
summary: Enable users to save incomplete forms and continue later from where they left off.
description: Develop user session persistence that allows users to save incomplete applications or service modification forms. Upon return, users can resume their applications seamlessly without data loss. Auto-save, draft recovery, and progress tracking must be integrated while maintaining full security and data integrity.

title: Real-Time Notifications and Email Alerts
summary: Provide live updates and notifications for user-initiated requests and system events.
description: Build a notification system that provides real-time updates through in-app alerts and email notifications. This includes request submission confirmations, approval or rejection status changes, and updates on pending actions. Notifications should integrate with workflow systems and adhere to user notification preferences to maintain relevance and reduce noise.

title: Audit Logs and Interaction History
summary: Maintain a secure, comprehensive record of all user interactions and actions.
description: Implement a centralized audit trail to capture and store all user activities, request submissions, and session data. This ensures transparency for users while providing the bank with traceability to meet compliance and regulatory obligations. The records should be easily retrievable, tamper-proof, and time-stamped with consistent data integrity mechanisms.

title: Core Banking System Integration Layer
summary: Integrate the self-service portal with the existing core banking infrastructure.
description: Build a stable and secure integration layer that allows the self-service portal to interact with the bank’s core systems in real-time. This layer should handle data synchronization for accounts, transactions, and user details, ensuring consistency across all systems. Incorporate load balancing, API management, and fault-tolerance mechanisms to maintain reliability and scalability.

title: Dedicated Portal Database and Performance Enhancement
summary: Implement an independent database to optimize system performance and reliability.
description: Design and deploy a dedicated database that operates as the data backbone for the portal, ensuring performance and minimizing dependency on core banking systems. Include caching strategies, load balancing, backup scheduling, and optimized data queries. Implement encryption, indexing, and redundancy features for superior uptime and data consistency.

title: Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) Implementation
summary: Restrict user access and visibility based on defined roles and authorizations.
description: Develop and enforce a Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) mechanism ensuring users can only view and interact with services appropriate to their access level. This includes defining role hierarchies, permissions, and segregation of duties between customers, relationship managers, and administrative personnel. Apply strict authorization and session control protocols to uphold security policies.
